name: Onam Sadhya - A taste of Kerala
description: Chef Mako, a half Malayali, and Akash Murali, a Kerala-born chef , are coming together to curate a unique Onam Sadhya experience at Love Ooru, Koramangala. This collaboration promises a festive feast that showcases a rich array of traditional dishes prepared with fresh, local ingredients. Join them for an unforgettable culinary journey that honors the spirit of Kerala’s most cherished festival.This curated community-style vegetarian lunch will include a 29-dish spread including Kadachakka Kuzhachatu (Breadfruit Stir Fry), Parippu Curry, Mathanga Elisseri (Yellow Pumpkin & peas curry ), Pavaka Theeyal (Spicy Bitter-gourd & tamarind gravy) Pineapple Kichadi, Avial, Red Rice & 2 payasams - Ada Pradhaman & Paal Payasam served on a banana leaf.*Takeaway option available between 12-4pm for minimum 2 person.What's an Onam Sadhya?Sadhya is not just about the food but also about community and togetherness. Families and friends come together to prepare and enjoy the meal, reflecting the spirit of unity and prosperity that the festival embodies. Onam Sadhya is a traditional vegetarian feast from Kerala, India, served during the festival of Onam, which celebrates the harvest season and the return of the mythical King Mahabali. The word "Sadhya" means banquet or feast in Malayalam, and this meal is a significant aspect of Onam celebrations.Venue: Love OORU﻿Rooftop / Sunsets / Wine & Grills https://www.instagram.com/love.ooru/?hl=enChef Mako : https://www.instagram.com/chef_mako?igsh=dndubmd6N21wOXBxAkash Murali : https://www.instagram.com/akashfooddoc?igsh=MWtrOXZ6c3JsZWRpbg==

name: Janapada Kala Darshana
description: "Janapada Kala Darshana" is a vibrant and cultural event that celebrates the essence of rural life, traditions and cuisine of Karnataka. Explore the rich heritage and history of the region with a guided museum tour at Jana Pada loka, showcasing artifacts and exhibits that highlight the cultural significance of the area.Enjoy sumptuous traditional meals at Kamat Lokaruchi, featuring an array of authentic local dishes that are served in a picturesque traditional village setup, offering a taste of rural life.Visit to chennapatna toy workshop run by Shilpa Trust, where artisans craft exquisite traditional toys, offering insights into the age-old art of toy making. Immerse yourself in the cultural heritage of the region with captivating performances like Dollu Kunitha, a dynamic and rhythmic drum dance."Janapada Kala Darshana" promises a delightful blend of cultural immersion, culinary delights, and interactive experiences that showcase the beauty of rural life and traditions.Special Offer: Enjoy a delightful 20% discount by using the coupon code "GVM20" at checkout. Valid until midnight tonight.

name: Onam Sadya
description: To celebrate the festival of Onam, we bring to you as our next pop up an authentic Onam Sadya. Enjoy the taste of Kerala with our Onam Sadya, featuring 25 traditional dishes served on a banana leaf. For a modern twist, we also offer a few select non-vegetarian options to complement the feast, creating a perfect blend of tradition and flavour.Here is a glimpse of the menu:1.⁠ ⁠Sambaram - Spiced buttermilk.2.⁠ ⁠Uppu - Salt.3.Naalu Keeri Upperi - Banana chips cut into four triangles.4.⁠ ⁠Sarkara Varatti - Jaggery-coated banana chips.5.⁠ ⁠Inji Puli - Ginger-tamarind chutney.6.⁠ ⁠Naaraanga Achar - Lemon pickle.7.⁠ ⁠Maanga Achar- Mango pickle.8.⁠ ⁠Beetroot Pachadi - Yogurt-based beetroot dish.9.⁠ ⁠Pineapple Pachadi - Yogurt-based pineapple dish.10.⁠ ⁠Cabbage Thoran - Cabbage with coconut.11.⁠ ⁠Aviyal - Mixed vegetable curry.12.⁠ ⁠Olan - Ash gourd and cowpeas in coconut milk.13.⁠ ⁠Mathanga Erissery - Pumpkin and coconut curry.14.⁠ ⁠Koottu Curry - Mixed vegetable and lentil curry.15.⁠ ⁠Kuthari / Ponni Ari - Red rice/White rice.16. Katti parippu - Simple cooked dal with ghee.17.⁠ ⁠Sambar 18.⁠ ⁠Moru Curry - Spiced curd curry.19.⁠ ⁠Rasam 20.⁠ ⁠Pappadam 21.⁠ ⁠Meen Porichath - Spicy fried fish.22.⁠ ⁠Kozhi Roast - Dry, spicy chicken roast.23.⁠ ⁠Koonthal Roast - Spicy squid roast.24.⁠ ⁠Chemeen Chammanthi - Shrimp and coconut chutney.25.⁠ ⁠Boli and Paalada Pradhaman PayasamTerms & Conditions:Please arrive punctually.Late arrivals may miss the first few courses.Booking Fee are non-refundable under all circumstances once booked. Tickets are transferrable to a third party.No shows/ cancellations will not be refunded, but you can reschedule your booking for within the week 48hrs before your slot is due.Alcohol will not be served to guests under the age of 21No liability or claims that may arise due to the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.The booking fee total includes the online transaction fee.Parking at the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Valet is available.Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. Incase you do not wish to be featured, let our team know.

name: Full Moon Release: A Breathwork Journey with Maria
description: We're officially entering eclipse season, with a powerful full moon lunar eclipse on 17th September. Eclipses are like full moons on steroids, amplifying transformative energy and bringing major shifts and releases into our lives.This month's theme invites you to connect with the fearless feminine within through a powerful guided breathing journey. Given the intensity of the Breathwork, I will be channeling Reiki during the session to support your energy flow. I’ll be guiding you every step of the way, ensuring you experience the full benefits. We'll conclude with a tarot reading to explore what this eclipse is bringing into your life.Join me on this journey to dance with the highest expression of your feminine light.Session flow:Welcome and IntroductionsCacao CeremonyInsight into Eclipse EnergiesBreathwork JourneyIntegrationTarot ReadingSharing CircleClose with herbal tea and nourishing food by C+C

name: Open Mat: Peak Posture(Free Yoga Session)
description: Open Mat: Saturday Stretch & Zen Fest!Roll out your mat and roll into a blissful Saturday at our Open Mat yoga session! Whether you're a seasoned yogi or a curious newbie this free flow is your ticket to weekend zen.What to expect:Stress-melting stretchesGood vibes onlyA community of fellow sun salutersSchedule:Week 1: Advance Hatha Yoga Asana:Holding asanas for a longer duration (15 breaths) to push your limits and develop endurance.Week 2: Peak Posture ClassOne Advance Asana will be selected as a peak posture. Complementary asanas will be practiced to help the practitioner reach the peak posture.Week 3: Hatha Vinyasa for Hip OpeningA flow including hatha asanas aimed at opening up the hips.Week 4: Chakra Yoga Asanas DescriptionPractice of specific asanas that target balancing of the 7 chakras.Bring your own mat water and a sprinkle of enthusiasm. Leave with newfound flexibility and a smile that'll last till Monday (we can't promise about Tuesday though).About your instructor:Spandhana leads individuals to holistic well-being with her expertise in yoga therapy and sound meditations. By merging ancient wisdom with modern needs she applies traditional yoga philosophies to empower people in today’s fast-paced world helping her clients harmonize body mind and spirit for balance and inner peace.

name: Open Mind: Free Breathwork & Meditation
description: Join us for a transformative hour-long journey into the powerful practices of breathwork and meditation. This session is designed to introduce you to these ancient techniques and help you integrate them into your daily life for enhanced well-being and personal growth.Class Flow:Introduction (5 minutes) Brief overview of the session and its benefits.Understanding Breathwork (10 minutes) Learn about the science and philosophy behind breathwork and its impact on your mind and body.Guided Breathwork Practice (15 minutes) Experience a guided session of various breathwork techniques, suitable for beginners and intermediate practitioners.Introduction to Meditation (10 minutes) Explore the basics of meditation, its different forms, and its potential benefits for mental and emotional well-being.Guided Meditation Practice (15 minutes) Participate in a guided meditation session, focusing on mindfulness and inner calm.Integrating Breathwork and Meditation into Daily Life (5 minutes) Learn practical tips and strategies for incorporating these practices into your daily routine for lasting benefits.Schedule:Week 1: Beginner PranayamaPractice of simple yet profound breathing techniques that can be practiced at any time of the day and which can be followed easily by beginners as well.Week 2: Cyclic MeditationA meditation technique that depends the connect with your bodyWeek 3: Pranayama/ MeditationSpecific advance pranayama techniques to elevate your meditative experience.Week 4:Chakra Meditation Mediation to balance the 7 chakras of the bodyAbout your instructor:Spandhana leads individuals to holistic well-being with her expertise in yoga therapy breathwork and guided meditations & soundbaths. By merging ancient wisdom with modern needs she applies traditional yoga philosophies to empower people in today’s fast-paced world helping her clients harmonize body mind and spirit for balance and inner peace.

name: The Art of Qi Gong: Launch Session
description: Join us on Saturday for a refreshing Qi Gong session that goes beyond your typical workout. We'll explore this ancient Chinese practice that combines gentle movements with mindful breathing and focused intention.This will be an introductory launch session and open to everyone!What is Qi Gong?Qi Gong is often called "moving meditation." It's based on traditional Chinese medicine and philosophy aiming to balance your body's energy (Qi) with the world around you. By syncing your mind, body and spirit, Qi Gong helps you feel more centered and relaxed.\What to ExpectEach session includes:1. Warm-Up: We'll start with easy stretches and breathing exercises to get you ready.2. Qi Gong Movements: You'll learn a series of slow purposeful movements that:  - Open energy pathways  - Improve circulation  - Enhance your Qi flow    We'll cover various styles including:  - Five elements Qi Gong (Wood Metal Fire Water Earth)  - Sound healing Qi Gong  - Spiral Qi Gong  - Animal-inspired flows3. Breathwork: We'll practice different breathing techniques to help you relax and focus such as:  - Double and triple wave breath  - Theta breathing  - Deep abdominal breathing4. Cool Down and Reflection: We'll end with gentle stretches and a short meditation. You'll have time to think about what you've learned and how to apply it in your daily life.Benefits- Physical: Improve flexibility strength and posture. Boost your immune system and overall health.- Mental: Enhance focus reduce stress and gain mental clarity.- Emotional: Find balance develop resilience and cultivate a positive outlook.- Social: Connect with others who share your interest in holistic wellness.No experience needed – all fitness levels are welcome. Come as you are and discover the Art of Qi Gong with us!By Coach Kaveri:I am a wellness coach with over 6 years of experience dedicated to helping people live healthier and happier lives. I teach Qigong primal movements breathwork meditation and kettlebell training. As the founder of Resilience Fitness System I combine these practices to help you achieve balance in your body mind and emotions. With my background as an Asia Champion in kettlebell sports I bring strong skills in building strength power and endurance to my sessions.

name: Cycle Circle for Women: Discussion & Journaling
description: This monthly gathering is a place for women to come together and honour our cyclical nature. We’ll explore a new understanding of the menstrual cycle as a biological rhythm that grants us a uniquely feminine vitality and wisdom. You’ll learn what it means to accommodate your natural fluctuations and how they can bring you back to life again, from the inside out. You’ll also find ways to tap into the instinctive wisdom of your own cycle, beyond just your period.Each session will include a guided somatic practice to restore and soothe you, time for personal reflection and journalling, some delicious teas and snacks to share and plenty of community care and support. Join for a chance to reconnect with your feminine nature and be nourished by the company of other wise and wild women.About Vaishali:Vaishali is a somatic wellness coach who creates personalized practices for healing growth and creativity. She focuses on the felt body’s role in life teaching harmony with biological intelligence to flow with life and access personal power. With certifications in yoga movement and meditation she offers breath repatterning embodied meditation yoga nidra and coaching for menstrual cycles and the nervous system.

description: Mat Pilates is a full body workout performed with a mix of body weight and the use of Pilates balls. It involves slow controlled movements which creates mind to muscle connection and heavily encourages to breathe through activating different muscle groups. It is challenging to both the body and mind and targets stability balance mobility flexibility posture and overall strength.Strengthen & Sculpt: Mat Pilates with a Twist! Experience a full-body Mat Pilates workout designed to:Sculpt your coreBuild overall strengthImprove mind-body connection for better coordinationEnhance mobility flexibility stability and balanc\We'll use slow controlled movements with an emphasis on proper form to target all major muscle groups.Get ready to spice things up! We'll incorporate a small Pilates ball to add an extra challenge and keep your workout dynamic. This is a great way to take your practice to the next level even if you're a beginner.Ready to feel stronger more flexible and energized?Wear comfortable workout clothes you can move freely inBring a water bottle to stay hydratedA yoga mat (optional some studios may provide them)

name: Breathing for Balance: An Autumn Equinox Journey
description: Join us for a transformative breathwork session as we celebrate the Autumn Equinox, a day where light and dark are perfectly balanced. This powerful event will focus on achieving balance in our lives—between the left and right sides of the body, the masculine and feminine energies, and the head and heart.Key Themes:Balance between Left and Right: Harmonizing the two sides of our physical and energetic being.Balance between Masculine and Feminine: Uniting opposing energies within us.Balance between Head and Heart: Aligning thoughts with feelings for greater clarity and peace.This session welcomes everyone—whether you're attending as a couple, with a friend or family member, or individually—focusing on fostering balance within and between ourselves.

name: Somatic Breathwork
description: ‘Without our breath nothing else would have any importance whatsoever; in fact we would not even exist.’ – FM AlexanderIn this workshop, we will explore theories and practices of breathing from the Alexander Technique and the Oxygen Advantage® Method. Breathing is normally an automatic process but by learning to bring conscious awareness and direction to it, we can promote greater ease and expansion throughout the breath and life processes.Some of the lenses we will explore include biomechanics (where in your body you breathe from/with), biochemistry (how your breath changes the internal organization of your body) and biorhythms (different patterns and rates of breathing and how they affect you). Using light movements, various postures and awareness-based practices, you will be guided to explore new ways of breathing and sensing yourself. The more possibilities we create in our frameworks, the more our breathing becomes effortless integrated and aligned with our everyday needs.This workshop will offer you simple tools that you can bring into your life for a fuller and livelier breathing experience. Join us for a gentle and exploratory journey into your breath and bodily patterns.Note: Practices will be done both seated and lying down. If you have any mobility restrictions, please let us know so that we can accommodate you.About your facilitators:Dayita Nereyeth is an Alexander Technique teacher dancer and editor. She is interested in creating space for people to observe and explore habits tensions and ways of being. www.dayitanereyeth.comVaishali Iyer is a somatic wellness coach and writer based in Bangalore. She offers body-oriented coaching and creates customised wellness protocols in the areas of breathing nervous system retraining menstrual cycle awareness and somatic meditation.

name: Warrior Rhythm +Menstrual Cycle Nutrition with Usha and Shrusti
description: Join us for a 70-minute Warrior Rhythm™ session with Usha Rao—an energizing blend of yoga flows, strength training, and HIIT, all set to a fun and rhythmic pace. It’s a fitness class with a mindful twist, helping you build strength, flexibility, and balance while keeping the energy high.But that’s not all! Shrusti will also be there to talk about how to support your body through the different phases of your menstrual cycle. She’ll share easy tips and insights on how to adjust your nutrition to feel your best throughout the month. After the class, we’ll gather for a delicious brunch featuring sumac and ginger infusion , nourishing salads, and energy balls .Come for the workout, stay for the community, and leave feeling nourished—inside and out.

description: Welcome to our Cake Baking Workshop WITH EggWe teach you to bake your cakes to perfection with giving you a product thats so flavourful, you wont believe you can bake these at home.What will you learn?-Airy Vanilla Sponge-Airy Chocolate Sponge-Couverture Chocolate Ganache-Salted Caramel-Whipping of Organic fresh cream (sourced from France)-Flavour Pairings (Caramel Chocolate Cake, Black Forest Cake, Classic Chocolate Cake , Fresh Cream Fruit Cake ).We make sure you embrace the art of baking and use the skills you will learn to best use.

name: Cheesecake Workshop
description: This class is for all the cheescake lovers. Here at Flourish, we teach you a variety of cheesecakes that range with technique and flavour. Tips, tricks and methods pertaining to perfecting your cheesecake is covered in this class. A variety of 3 cheesecakes is taught.-Baked New York Cheesecake -Frozen Fruit Cheesecake -Cotton Cheesecake (Japanese Cheesecake) All information regarding the baking of these widely different cheesecake will be passed on to our students. We provide you with all the ingredients, tools and know-how for the class including a handout which you will be taking home. Along with that, you will be taking the lovely cheesecakes you've made at the class, back home to your friends and family. Join us for a fun filled, cheese-centric workshop! Cheers!

name: Shamanic sound healing with Lifang Huang
description: Shamanic sound healing is a practice rooted in ancient spiritual traditions, where sound is used as a powerful tool for healing and transformation.  Join Taiwanese Shamanic Sound healer Lifang Huang (@lifang_sound_healer_ ) for an evening of deep sound vibrations. Lifang Creates a healing sound bath using Tibetan singing bowls Nepalese shamanic drums her voice and other instruments.We will also include a cacao ceremony which will help in your nervous system regulation. During a session, the participant typically lies down in a relaxed state while the practitioner plays the instruments in a rhythmic and intentional manner. The sounds are often rhythmic and repetitive, inducing a meditative or trance-like state that allows the participant to journey inward. This altered state of consciousness is where healing is said to occur, as the sounds help to align the mind, body, and spirit.

name: Cooke Town Boys | Brunch with Chef Gautam Krishnankutty + Loafer & Co
description: Cooke Town BoysBrunch with Chef Gautam Krishnankutty + Loafer & CoJoin us for an exclusive tasting menu brunch that brings together the creative flair of Chef Gautam Krishnakutty and the artisanal expertise of Loafer & Co., Cooke Town's beloved. This one-of-a-kind pop-up celebrates the art of flavor pairing, showcasing a harmonious blend of globally inspired dishes, vibrant condiments, and meticulously crafted breads.Chef Gautam Krishnakutty’s culinary mastery shines through in each dish, thoughtfully curated to highlight the interplay of complex textures and bold flavors. From innovative takes on classic recipes to surprising combinations, the menu promises a journey of discovery and indulgence.Loafer & Co.’s signature breads, known for their rich character and artisanal quality, perfectly complement the brunch menu, adding depth and enhancing every bite. This collaboration between chef and baker is more than just a meal—it’s a celebration of taste, craft, and community.Indulge in a melange of flavors, textures, and stories that reflect the passion and creativity of Cooke Town’s culinary scene. This is more than brunch; it's an experience designed to delight and inspire.Non- Vegetarian MenuCourse 1Stuffed Bombolone with Smoked Sardine Taramasalata. Served with Mizuna Greens tossed with Fermented Kaffir Lime Rind Chilli Sambal and Toasted Sesame OilCourse 2Toasted Bagel with Egg Salad Mousse, Spicy Pickled Eggplant and Fried Garlic DustCourse 3Sourdough Milk Bread Prawn Toast with Sautéed Pickled Mustard Greens and Sweet Chilli Oil Course 4Kitfo Beef Tartare with Black Rice Melba Toast. Served with Labneh and Cured Egg Yolk Course 5Rice Congee with Cured Lap Yuk Bacon and Youtiao Chinese CrullersCourse 6Brioche French Toast with Caramelised Bananas, crushed Peanut Chikki and IcecreamVegetarian MenuCourse 1Stuffed Bombolone with Smoked Mushroom Pate. Served with Mizuna Greens tossed with Fermented Kaffir Lime Rind Chilli Sambal and Toasted Sesame OilCourse 2Toasted Bagel with Coriander Peanut Cream Cheese, Spicy Pickled Eggplant and Fried Garlic DustCourse 3Corn and Woodear Mushroom Sourdough Milk Toast with Sauteed Pickled Mustard Greens and Sweet Chilli OilCourse 4King Oyster Mushrooms sautéed with Niter Kibbeh Ghee. Served with Labneh and Black Rice Melba ToastCourse 5Rice Congee with Shiitake Mushrooms and Youtiao Chinese crullersCourse 6Brioche French Toast with Caramelised Bananas, Crushed Peanut Chikki and Ice creamTerms and Conditions : The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during an eventConservatory is located on the 2nd floor of courtyard which is a 44 steps climb upDo not purchase tickets from anyone other than on the ticketing platform.No-shows and cancellations are non-refundable by all means.Tickets are non-transferable and are for personal use only.Children aged 7 and above require a ticket to attend the meal. If you are bringing a child under 7, please inform us in advance, as we do not have a baby seat at the venue.The schedule is subject to change in case of an emergency or any event out of our control.Management will entertain no liability or claims arising due to the consumption or intake of any food or drink.Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Paid Valet Parking at Rs. 200 per car.The holder of this ticket grants organizers the right to use, in perpetuity, all or any part of the recording of any video or still footage made of the holder's appearance on any channel without any further approval.Please note that both vegetarian and non-vegetarian dishes are prepared in the same kitchen.Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. If you do not wish to be featured, let our team know.

name: Screening: In the Mood for Love (2000) | Movie Under the Stars
description: Join us for an open-air screening of In The Mood For Love (2000), with a three-course dinner and popcorn.*Wines and other beverages will be available for purchase at the venue.About the movie"In the Mood for Love" (2000), directed by Wong Kar-wai, is a visually stunning and emotionally poignant film set in 1960s Hong Kong. The story follows Mr. Chow (Tony Leung) and Mrs. Chan (Maggie Cheung), two neighbors who discover that their spouses are having an affair with each other. As they spend time together, they form a deep and complex bond, trying to understand their own feelings while maintaining propriety in a conservative society.Despite their growing affection, they decide not to act on their emotions, fearing to become like their unfaithful partners. The film is a masterful exploration of love, longing, and missed opportunities, beautifully captured through lush cinematography, atmospheric music, and the lingering tension between two people bound by circumstance yet separated by societal norms and personal restraint.3-Course Dinner MenuCourse 1: Veggie rice paper rolls with peanut sauceCourse 2: (Veg) Cantonese soy sauce fried noodles served with sauteed bok choy, oyster mushroom and broccoli(Non Veg) Cantonese soy sauce fried noodles served with 5 spice roast chickenCourse 3:Coconut pannacotta with passion fruit______Terms and Conditions:The management is not responsible for any injury or damage that may occur during the event.No liability or claims arising from the consumption or intake of any food or drink will be entertained by the management.Parking near the event premises is at the risk of the vehicle owner.Valet service is available at a charge of Rs. 200 per vehicle.Photographs and videos of ticket holders may be uploaded to social media. If you prefer not to be featured, please inform our team.Tickets are non-refundable in case of cancellation or no-show.In case of rain, the event will be moved indoors.

name: Unapologetically Indian Meal with Strangers
description: Gear up for a flavor-filled adventure across India!Make Wednesday your midweek break to recharge and keep the energy going 🏁⚡.Join us at Jugni - for an unforgettable evening of modern Indian cuisine!For this edition of the Wednesday Supper Club, we’re stepping into Jugni, one of Bangalore’s finest Indian dining experiences, endorsed by the one and only @eat_by_fazi himself! 🌟Jugni is where India’s flavors come together in perfect harmony—from chaat straight out of UP to kick off your meal, to a mishti-style ice cream with an eastern twist. 🍦🍛✨ And just like the food, expect a full Bengaluru-style mashup of people—whether you’re a pakka foodie or someone who loves macha-level fun with new faces, this is the place to be! 😎In true Namma Ooru Bengaluru fashion, you’ll dive into diverse flavors while vibing with a crew that’s just as colorful. Share some gupshup, and be part of a night where food, culture, and conversations flow as easily as that next cocktail.When? WednesdayWhere? JugniDon’t miss it—come for the food, stay for the fam! Yen macha, this is one supper club you don’t want to skip!

name: ARAKU Open House: Coffee Around The World
description: Instant isn’t in our vocabulary; with ARAKU Coffee, slow is the way to go! In celebration of International Coffee Day, Introducing ARAKU Open House: an open-for-all invitation to explore the world of specialty coffee. This program, under ARAKU World Specialty Coffee Academy (AWSCA), aims to foster a more inclusive and accessible coffee community, one cup at a time.What to Expect:Taste Global Coffees: Taste international coffees and sample a selection of ARAKU’s finest SKUs, guided by our coffee mentor and expert, Sherri Johns. As a renowned barista trainer, Head Judge of the Gems of Araku Competition, and Authorised SCA Trainer (AST), Sherri brings a wealth of knowledge and passion to each session.Connect and Share: Immerse yourself in a vibrant community of coffee enthusiasts. Swap stories, rituals, and traditions with fellow coffee lovers from around the world, and explore how local cafes and global cultures intertwine through coffee.Who Should Attend: Coffee aficionados eager to deepen their knowledge of global coffee culture. Those curious about different coffee varieties and brewing techniques. Anyone looking to connect with a lively community of coffee enthusiasts and professionals.Spaces are limited to just 15 participants, so be sure to secure your spot at the earliest.October 1st, Tuesday | 4:30 PM OnwardsAWSCA, 1st floor, Araku Coffee, Indiranagar, Bangalore.

name: In The House with Bandra Born, a Bar Takeover
description: For one night only, MURO will be transformed into a lively Bandra-inspired cocktail haven, with an exclusive cultural exchange that goes beyond a typical bar takeover. We’re bringing the energy, creativity, and flair of Bandra’s cocktail culture right to your glass.Ravi Potle, the bar Manager, Bandra Born known for his innovative approach and captures the essence of Bandra’s eclectic and dynamic spirit, showcasing fresh, seasonal ingredients with a local twist. Join us on the mezzanine deck for #InTheHouse, where the conversation between Mumbai and Bangalore flows as smoothly as the drinks. Expect a delightful mix of bold, refreshing cocktails with complex, layered flavors that highlight the best of Bandra’s cocktail craftsmanship.This is your chance to experience a night where creativity, tradition, and flavor come together in perfect harmony.
